title: Lord Trimble urges DUP to vote for Boris Johnson's Brexit deal as it 'does not breach Good Friday Agreement'
text:
One of the architects of the Irish peace process urged the DUP to vote for Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal on Friday, as he announced that in his view it did not breach the Good Friday Agreement.

Lord Trimble, a Nobel Peace Prize winner, hailed Mr Johnson’s agreement as a “great step forward,” despite warnings from the DUP that it would cut Northern Ireland adrift from the rest of the UK without their consent.

“This is fully in accordance with the spirit of the Good Friday Agreement,” the former Ulster Unionist Party leader said.

"What we now want to see is for the DUP and Sinn Fein to act together to bring the Good Friday Agreement back to life. This is not the time to be looking for excuses...
description: One of the architects of the Irish peace process urged the DUP to vote for Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal on Friday, as he announced that in his view it did not breach the Good Friday Agreement.
